Method Detail

readExtensions

public static List<String> readExtensions(SubstringReader reader)
                                   throws DecodeException
Reads the value for an "extra" parameter. It will handle a single unquoted word (which is technically illegal, but we'll allow it), a single quoted string, or an open parenthesis followed by a space-delimited set of quoted strings or unquoted words followed by a close parenthesis.

Parameters:
reader - The string representation of the definition.
Returns:
The "extra" parameter value that was read.
Throws:
DecodeException - If a problem occurs while attempting to read the value.

DecodeException

Reads the next OID from the definition, skipping over any leading spaces.

Parameters:

Returns:
The OID read from the definition.
Throws:

readOID

public static String readOID(SubstringReader reader)
                      throws DecodeException
Reads the attribute description or numeric OID, skipping over any leading or trailing spaces.

Parameters:
reader - The string representation of the definition.
Returns:
The attribute description or numeric OID read from the definition.
Throws:
DecodeException - If a problem is encountered while reading the name or OID.

readOIDLen

public static String readOIDLen(SubstringReader reader)
                         throws DecodeException
Reads the next OID from the definition, skipping over any leading spaces. The OID may be followed by a integer length in brackets.

Parameters:
reader - The string representation of the definition.
Returns:
The OID read from the definition.
Throws:
DecodeException - If a problem is encountered while reading the token name.

readTokenName

public static String readTokenName(SubstringReader reader)
                            throws DecodeException
Reads the next token name from the definition, skipping over any leading or trailing spaces or null if there are no moretokens to read.

Parameters:
reader - The string representation of the definition.
Returns:
The token name read from the definition or null .
Throws:
DecodeException - If a problem is encountered while reading the token name.
